description: A quick and simple Thai omelette delivers all the fragrance and flavour you need.
ingredient: [{"name": "eggs", "units": null, "amount": 2}, {"name": "fish sauce", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "spring onion", "units": null, "amount": 2}, {"name": "vegetable oil", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 3}, {"name": "Thai chilli", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "Sriracha sauce", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "cherry tomatoes", "units": null, "amount": 4}, {"name": "cilantro", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 2}]
step_by_step: 1. Combine the beaten egg with a little chopped spring onion and fish sauce. 2. Using a wok, heat the oil until hot then pour in the egg mixture. It will puff up immediately. Let this cook for 2 minutes then flip it over for another two. The exterior will be crisp and the interior light and fluffy. Drain on paper towels and then serve hot or leave to cool. Garnish with the tomato, more spring onion, some cilantro, a squirt of Sriracha and a generous sprinkle of sliced Thai chillies.
nutrition_info: Calories: 156 kcal, Carbohydrates: 7 g, Protein: 13 g, Fat: 9 g, Saturated Fat: 3 g, Sodium: 2237 mg, Potassium: 440 mg, Fiber: 1 g, Sugar: 4 g.
notes: Omelettes will stay fresh in the fridge for 3-4 days. They can be eaten cold or gently rewarmed. Fresh is best for this recipe.
